content:
Posted: February 15, 2015
												7/10Fun little horror game, recommend.It's more frustrating than scary, though.  Night 5 was the worst for me because Freddy is a serious troll.  I found that if you don't stress yourself out over it, then you do better and I was able to get through the first four nights without dying.  And there's a pattern you can follow to help you out.  Wish the backstory was more in your face and obvious because it's so easy to miss as it is right now.--Pros--- Great atmosphere for a horror game- Love the use of sounds to indicate the locations of the animatronic- I love the graphics, even if they are mostly just pictures- Foxy's little animation is good for catching people off guard--Cons--- Jumpscares get old really fast- Power system runs on dumb logic- Backstory isn't obvious enough- Needs more creepy imagery when you're going insane- Why do we keep coming back?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 23, 2014
												Five Nights at Freddy's is a refreshing take on the survival horror genre.  You work the night shift at a children's pizza restaurant akin to a Chuck-E-Cheese; however, that is where the similarities stop.  Fazbear's Pizza has a shady past, and a few "malfunctioning" animatronics seeking your inadvertent death.  You have to survive the nights with only your cameras, doors, lights, and quick click reactions.  Don't be too hasty or your limited supply of power will run out!There are three unique aspects that make this a must play--the simple design/gameplay mechanics (you are stuck in a room--no escape just survival), sinister environment (camera features and sounds play with your sanity), and the constant suspense (you see them coming closer and CLOSER).On the other hand, the jumpscares get tiresome and the gameplay repetitive, but that doesn't overpower the great aspects of the game.  I'm looking forward to the next installment.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												This game is very unique, and downright terrifying. I first found this game a few months ago when only the demo was available. I played it, and I had no idea what I getting myself into...This game is terrifying, it's a point and click game but it has a crushingly terrifying atmosphere, because you could be jumpscared at any moment. In this game, you play as a man who got himself a job at a kids pizza store named Freddy Fazbear's Pizza. You have been hired to work the night shift and you begin the game at Night 1. You cannot move in this game, you can only operate the door lights, peek up at your security cameras or shut/open your doors. You are unaware of the fact that the animatronics you are looking after (which are basically animal robots which are mascots to the store) actually move around at night, and if they find you...they will kill you.You spend the five nights of this game constantly peeking up at the cameras making sure all of the animatronics are in place, and when they move you must keep track of them otherwise they will get into your office and horrifyingly jumpscare you. That is basically how you survive in this game, you keep an eye on the animatronics and when they get near your office, you just shut the doors so they can't get in. Sounds pretty easy huh?Well, these animatronics cut off your camera when they move around, which means that you have no idea where they are and they could have just ran straight next to your door without you knowing and get you. Also, if you're late catching them they will cut off the power to your doors, meaning certain death. If that wasn't enough however, you have a power bar which means that you must be careful with the amount of power you use. (You lose power by looking at your camera, using the door lights and shutting the doors.) And once that percentage hits 0, you have only a matter of seconds to live before Freddy comes and finishes you off. There are various ways you have to handle the animatronics in order to survive, and they all work differently but I am not going to tell you how to handle them because then the experience just won't the the same for you! The jumpscares will make you jump, and will make you scream and it WILL happen so if you're going to buy this game, make sure you know what you're getting into! The couple of negative things I could say about this game is that it does get tedious because once you know how to survive, that's it! That's it for the rest of the nights and you'll be safe, once you know the way around the game you will breeze through it. Another thing is that, after a certain amount of jumpscares; you do get used to them and they will not scare you so much, which does ruin the atmosphere a bit and may just frustrate you if you fail.Overall, I'd definitely recommend giving this game a try and it will be challenge to complete all seven of the nights (yes, seven!) Just make sure you're prepared before going on this rollercoaster!

												Although the game might seem as a cheap jumpscare type game,it only jumpscares you as a punishment for messing up.This game offers no weapons at all to fight,so you feel defenseless,adding to the stress.This game really builds up stress to make you mess up,and god if it isnt hard.Its hard in a good way though,pretty challenging.This game requires alot of concentration since in later nights,1 single messup can ruin the night and get you killed.The community has come up with really interesting theories about the game.

Posted: August 24, 2014
												if you don't know what suspense is.... I suggest you play this game.Some reccommendations for this game will include:Playing at nightPlay with headphones (medium - loud volume) play by yourself for nightmares or play with friends over for hilarity... or a few extra pants to throw in the washing machineA few things I would like to see in this game would be.A radio that you can click on to play some music/talk radio stations on, -- But that takes away power as usual -- talk radio stations would have stuff like news relating to the pizza place you work at, like; "In other news, the man who went missing was last reported at his night job at Freddy Fazbear's Pizzeria" or something along those lines...On the custom day (Day 7), you should be able to have an optional "Infinite Power" cheat.A special ending for completing 20/20/20/20 on the 7th day.... or an acheivement or something...All in all it's a great game to play if you're bored and want a good scare 8.5/10

content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
												Five Nights at Freddy's is a nice little 2d click-and point game that is NOT for the faint of heart. It has tons of jumpscares, so if you don't like those, then don't play this. It has a nice backstory with many easter eggs, including (nope). Some become obvious after a while. This game has spooky ambience, so if you quit right as you start the game (like I did multiple times), I wouldn't be suprised.

content:
Posted: September 19, 2014
												This, from the moment I first saw gameplay on Youtube, was destined to become one of my top 3 games. I. Love. It. It's a refreshingly new kind of horror that makes you think. No blood or gore, just strictly psychological. I'm obsessed. I have hours logged on the app version on my ipad, but find the PC version far superior. Once. my friends told me the rumors behind the game, I became even more curious. It is basic, difficult, and thrilling. Which how such a basic game can create hours of horrific fun. 10/10, 100/100 double thumbs up!!!

content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												Scary? Yes.Horror GOTY? No.Five nights at Freddy's, although I have not gotten very far, is scary. It's not the kind of game you'd like to play at 3 am in a dark room. But is it a horror title? Not really. The atmosphere of the game is moderately creepy, and you're more just waiting for the next jump scare, than afraid of every moment. The characters are creepy, and will make you seriously consider ever going to Chuck-E-Cheese's again. There are many games out, which fully immerse you in the story, such as Outlast, or Amnesia, but this is not comparable. This game goes for something completely different than they do. Those games are jump scares mixed with a lot of atmosphere, and fear of turning the next corner. Five nights at Freddy's is not an uncomfortable atmosphere. Chuck-E-Cheese's is not scary, sure, it's creepy, but not scary. The location is about as non-creepy as it can get, short of having all the lights on and kids running around. The only thing that makes the game scary, is the characters. You're watching for the 3 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s the whole game, and focusing on their locations versus the atmosphere of the location itself.Although all of that, this game tries to be something new, and it succeeded. It doesn't follow the norm of what the horror category is, and because of that, this game is getting big. Now that there's a bit more funding, I can't wait to see #2! Long live Freddy's.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
												I love this game. I even beat the legendary 4/20 mode. And I have to say, the game is good.......ok i can't.....this is probably the new slender trend or something because there is something about this game that just makes it unique. And the creator put sooooooooooooooooooo much hidden easter eggs or hidden lore into the game the game still has theories to this day. And the jumpscares are really really f***ing good. Sure you can get used to them and expect them after a few times but if your not expecting it, it WILL get you. And then there's freddy..........I have the utmost respect for this character out of all of them, not my favorite, but the most respect for the main character. all the characters I like but never really fear them, then there's freddy, i don't fear him but every time i hear that laugh.......the♥♥♥♥♥♥gets real. And his jumpscares/deaths are the most unpredictable out of the whole game. after his song, could kill you instantly, a few seconds, or could make you wait for like f***ing 20 seconds. Then when he's in your office, pretty much same thing but much sooner. So for all those people who say this game is nothing special or is not scary, go mann up (see what I did there?) and buy the game or go try it at another friends house, I will guarantee that you will not be ready for freddy.100/10 for game. 1000/10 for entire series.

content:
Posted: November 5, 2014
Five Nights at Freddy's ReviewA security camera controlling horror and timing game.In Five Nights at Freddy's you play as a security guard working late shifts in a restaurant filled with animatronics. The restaurant is very much like the American diner "Chuck E. Cheese's". The games is scary, I couldn't even survive two nights. This game is by far the best horror game of this year. The great aspect of it is that you're isolated, trapped in one position. In most horror games the goal is to run away from the ghost or monster or creature or whatever the scary villain be in the game. However, in this game, you can't run, making it even more scarier...Yes, plenty of jumpscares. Honestly, I really don't like the stereotype of playing a horror game in the dark alone. Yes, it makes it creepy but it's honestly better to play with a friend sat next to you. You just have to trust me on that one! There's also a few easter eggs you can catch a glimpse of in the game so that's good for all you easter egg hunters. Overall one of the best horror games of 2014, a must-have for horror fanatics. Be warned though, most of the fanbase is obsessive and irritating and most of this game's sequels are awful.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
												Me and some of my friends play horror games during school at lunch sometimes. My friends really wanted me to buy this so we can play it. I thought the game was over hyped and didn't see what was scary about it. After playing I found out its rather scary. The gameplay is simple yet it works perfectly. Just sit in a room, watch the cameras, close the doors, flicker the lights and wait for your night to end. Watching the animatronics is very creepy as one second they'll all be there and the next "ooh, wheres Bunny gone?" and you'll find her right down the hall from where you are. The little hallucinations that happen to you can be very scary as well. The pre-rendered graphics are pretty cool and Freddy and the rest of the animatronics models look really neat. Now onto the not so great stuff. From what I've played and how I've been playing, the power seems to not last very long. I can get rather scared at times so maybe its from me just looking at the cameras too much. The jumpscares can be predictable and if you've seen some one else beat the game there isn't really any reason to buy it. Its nothing groundbreaking and the game is a little over hyped. Made it to night 6. I have now worked out how to save more power. The animatronics move a lot more and it can be rather frightening. I'm not as scared of the jumpscares as I was when they firsted happend, mainly because if you listen you can hear them behind the cameras. Also, night 6 is tough. Like really tough. The animatronics move more often and you ALWAYS have to make sure Foxy hasn't moved, because if he comes running you'll have only a few seconds to close the door before you hear what the fox really says as he shoves you inside a suit. I used to get bullied by my friend because I was scared of the jumpscares. I'm not scared now though so HAH, suck it Felix. *ahem* anyway, Five Nights at Freddy's is an excellent (a little over hyped) indie horror game that I highly recomend you get. I think the game would possibly be better on a WiiU or with a tablet hooked up to your computer to be used a the camera monitor. It would make the experince more immersive in my opinion.So yeah, if you've seen your favorite youtuber complete the game don't bother getting it. Its just not as fun.But yeah, I like this game and can't wait for FNaF 2 to be realeased.9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												I've seen horror games... horror games that you've seen... But you have no right to call this a bad game. You have a right to be scared of the game, you have a right to do that. But you have no right to judge it by its jumpscares. It's impossible  to put into words to describe what is necessary to those who do not know what a horror game is. Horror... Horror has a face... and you must make a friend of horror. Horror and moral terror are your friends. If they are not, then they are enemies to be feared. They are truly enemies. I remember when I was playing Slender... seems a thousand centuries ago. I played at a friend's house to just get it over with. I left the computer because I had to eat dinner. After I fin-OKAY, OKAY, I'll stop ripping off Apocalypse Now for Now and just say that this is easily, EASILY, the definitive horror game of 2014 (In... case you didn't know that already). Five Nights at Freddy's is the product of indie video game developer Scott Cawthon, and his first attempt at a horror game. From my knowledge, he did make some games in the past, and weren't necessarily bad either, but did, on occasion, get some negative feedback from players complaining that the character movements in those games resembled those of animatronics. Fast forward a few years later and Scott decides to USE this negative feedback to make his own original game about, you guessed it, animatronic anthropomorphic (animathopomorphnic) animals out to kill you and you have a limited power supply, limited vision, a security camera, and a FAN (*shudders*).... Oh, and also it's actually the 4th restaurant in a series of restaurants that all closed down because one closed down because of a murder of a child outside FredBear's Family Diner, and the second one (Fazbear's Pizza) closing down because of multiple parents complaining of the smell of the animatronics, comparing them to reanimated carcasses, and the third one closing down because of a certain Bite of '87. So... yeah, bad history. I could go more in-depth with this plot (Puppet is behind everything (probably)), but I'll save that for the FNaF wiki.Now, gameplaywise, THIS game is what I call a break in the horror timeline. The typical indie horror game of 2013 or 2014 was very simple. You're a person whom you don't know the name of and you're trying to escape an asylum, or maze, or house, or-- and you're treated to cheap jumpscares, Unity graphics, lame story, bad voice acting, and general 2013-14 horror game logic: it's not scary. BUT, Five Nights at Freddy's changes this completely. It's a game with generic, yet unpredictable jumpscares (especially during the 1st and 2nd Nights), and that makes them very effective, EXTREME rising tension, good replayability, simple, but original graphics, ENGAGING AS ♥♥♥♥ backstory, and a guy on the phone who talks to you every night. Think of him as George Clooney from Gravity: he's there to relieve your stress for 3 minutes.With all of these components in place, Scott Cawthon made a game that probably changed the horror gaming industry for a while. It's honestly the very first horror game that I've ever played that I keep coming back to nearly every day to have another shot at that ♥♥♥♥ing 20/20/20/20 mode. And with that said, if my review wasn't descriptive enough, and you've NEVER seen any footage, information, or talk about this game at ALL, go on YouTube and check out Markiplier's complete playthrough of the game (you won't regret it).tl;dr While jumpscares, and difficulty can lead to the game eventually not becoming scary at all, Nights 1-3 in Five Nights at Freddy's were the scariest 3 days of my life, and, potentially, my most chaotic. Pay the man your 5 dollars and play this game.Also: return of the honk.19.87/20

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
												Me and some of my friends play horror games during school at lunch sometimes. My friends really wanted me to buy this so we can play it. I thought the game was over hyped and didn't see what was scary about it. After playing I found out its rather scary. The gameplay is simple yet it works perfectly. Just sit in a room, watch the cameras, close the doors, flicker the lights and wait for your night to end. Watching the animatronics is very creepy as one second they'll all be there and the next "ooh, wheres Bunny gone?" and you'll find her right down the hall from where you are. The little hallucinations that happen to you can be very scary as well. The pre-rendered graphics are pretty cool and Freddy and the rest of the animatronics models look really neat. Now onto the not so great stuff. From what I've played and how I've been playing, the power seems to not last very long. I can get rather scared at times so maybe its from me just looking at the cameras too much. The jumpscares can be predictable and if you've seen some one else beat the game there isn't really any reason to buy it. Its nothing groundbreaking and the game is a little over hyped. Made it to night 6. I have now worked out how to save more power. The animatronics move a lot more and it can be rather frightening. I'm not as scared of the jumpscares as I was when they firsted happend, mainly because if you listen you can hear them behind the cameras. Also, night 6 is tough. Like really tough. The animatronics move more often and you ALWAYS have to make sure Foxy hasn't moved, because if he comes running you'll have only a few seconds to close the door before you hear what the fox really says as he shoves you inside a suit. I used to get bullied by my friend because I was scared of the jumpscares. I'm not scared now though so HAH, suck it Felix. *ahem* anyway, Five Nights at Freddy's is an excellent (a little over hyped) indie horror game that I highly recomend you get. I think the game would possibly be better on a WiiU or with a tablet hooked up to your computer to be used a the camera monitor. It would make the experince more immersive in my opinion.So yeah, if you've seen your favorite youtuber complete the game don't bother getting it. Its just not as fun.But yeah, I like this game and can't wait for FNaF 2 to be realeased.9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												This is it, your chance to get paid! so you...work at a Pizzeria? dafuq? dude, you could have been a cashier! alot safer ya know? anyways, your role is the Night guard, Mike Schmidt watching over Freddy Fazbears Pizza. the cast stars Freddy Fazbear, Bonnie the Bunny, Chica The Chicken, and the 4th broken down animatronic, Foxy The Pirate Fox. these 4 can roam around freely during the day, but to keep their servos from locking up, the company leaves them on over night. this is a problem for you cause that means they can get into your office, and after hours, they won't know your a human and instead will think your an endoskeleton missing its costume, and will try to stuff you in one. or in simpler terms...KEEL you.You're not allowed outside of the office, and must stay there. this adds a feeling of helplessness to the situation. What you have are 2 doors, the cameras, and lights for the doors. you watch the cameras to make sure you know where the animatronics are. Bonnie and Chica go for your doors, and you can catch them in the blindspots(Right outside your door!)if you check the light and you cant find them anywhere. when you DO catch them in the lights, SHUT THE DAMN DOOR! there is one big thing many players die from. the POWER meter. the building is on limited power during the night, and keeping the doors down drains that power quickly. same with using both lights and doing ALL AT THE SAME TIME WILL GET YOU ♥♥♥♥ING MURDERED. so only close the doors when you have to, and only check the lights once every time you pull down the cameras. One big flaw to this strategy is the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ himself, FOXY. keep those cameras off for too long and Foxy comes running down the west hall(yes RUNNING instead of actually just ♥♥♥♥in standin there)and instantly ends your night. you CAN block him with the door if you got lightning fast reflexes OOOOOR you know he's coming. he WILL take a bit of your power from banging on that door though, so try not to trigger him and keep the cameras on frequently but not too frequently.Freddy FAZ♥♥♥♥ over here is the ultimate troll. he gets active on Night 3 and will hide in the dark so you usually wont see him until he enters the East Hall Corner. AKA near your door. no one truely knows how Freddy Fazbear works in this game, and thats the reason why the MANY, MANY deaths on night 5 were infact caused by mr FREDDY FAZ♥♥♥♥. he can also kill you with the power out. lose all that power on ANY NIGHT and he will play "Toreador March" for a random time. the longest possible windup is about 1 minute, but most players were "Saved by the bell" when 6 AM hit DURING Freddy Fazbear's Toreador March. so what do I think of this game? Great! its a great addition to the horror genre and while it isn't very scary nowadays, it still gives me those chills from time to time.Grade:A-ACTUALLY, THERES GOLDEN FREDDY TO. I HOPE YOU CAN FIND HIM :3

content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
												I love this game. I even beat the legendary 4/20 mode. And I have to say, the game is good.......ok i can't.....this is probably the new slender trend or something because there is something about this game that just makes it unique. And the creator put sooooooooooooooooooo much hidden easter eggs or hidden lore into the game the game still has theories to this day. And the jumpscares are really really f***ing good. Sure you can get used to them and expect them after a few times but if your not expecting it, it WILL get you. And then there's freddy..........I have the utmost respect for this character out of all of them, not my favorite, but the most respect for the main character. all the characters I like but never really fear them, then there's freddy, i don't fear him but every time i hear that laugh.......the♥♥♥♥♥♥gets real. And his jumpscares/deaths are the most unpredictable out of the whole game. after his song, could kill you instantly, a few seconds, or could make you wait for like f***ing 20 seconds. Then when he's in your office, pretty much same thing but much sooner. So for all those people who say this game is nothing special or is not scary, go mann up (see what I did there?) and buy the game or go try it at another friends house, I will guarantee that you will not be ready for freddy.100/10 for game. 1000/10 for entire series.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												Five Nights at Freddy's is a first person, survival horror, point and click game. You work at Freddy Fazbears pizzeria, a place were the main attraction is Freddy Fazbear and his three friends. They are animatronic robots programmed to please the crowds, but have an unpredictable behavior at night. You are the night security guard, unfortunatly, and have to keep an eye on these animatronics while making sure that they don't get into your office and "forcefully stuff you into a Freddy Fazbear suit".The gameplay is simple, you are stuck in your office and have the ability to control the lights and doors to your office. You can also monitor the building through the cameras scattered around. To spice things up a bit, you have a limited amount of power that gets drained everytime you use the lights, doors and cameras, meaning that you have to leave yourself exposed in order to survive. The game also gets progressively more difficult after each night.This game has all the ingredients to make you extremly paranoid, due to the lighting, sound effects and creepy animatronics. The game awards you for remaining calm and using your recourses efficiently, and punishes you if you screw up and start to panic. It's also worth mentioning that the game will occasionally attempt to ruin your concentration by, among other things, flash detailed 3D images of perticular animatronics (notably terrifying).The story is very appealing. Scott Cawthon (the creator of FNAF) left us few clues, notes, messages and easter eggs for us to add up, only to find a creepy story that fits perfectly well into the game's setting.I really enjoyed playing this game at first during the first nights, it was a unique yet terrifying experience that few games has given me. But during the final nights the game was so difficult, it made me use a boring and repetetive strategy called "rinse and repeat" in order to complete the final night, which took away my freedom of choice to complete the game "my way". I didn't feel like playing the extra nights because it felt like a chore.This points out the biggest flaw and possibly the only flaw this game has, you need both skill and luck to complete the game. It could be a pro that adds to the experience or a con that ruins it.Anyway, this is a superb horror game that i would recommend to anyone who is interested in horror games. I can almost guarantee that you will scream like a little girl at least once while playing this game.10/10 would get stuffed into a Freddy Fazbear suit again.Are you ready for Freddy?

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												A game with a good premise.  Prays on the fear of being alone with a bunch of freaky animatronic robots.  On top of that, you have a limited amount of power to use in order to keep track of them, to keep doors shut, or to turn on the lights.  When you run out of power, bad things tend to happen, though sometimes good things happen, like beating night 6 as someone with a big smile plays you a pleasant tune.  The game gives you minimal instructions on how it actually works, such as what the lights do, but does give you hints about what you should be doing.  Once you figure out a solid strategy, things mostly fall into place, though sometimes a good friend still slips into the room.  The game isn't that long, took me around 2 to 2 1/2 hours to finish all 6 nights plus play a custom game.  Got a couple of frights out of it.  Also, listening to Bebop scream like a girl as he was murdered on night 3 was worth the price of a little over a buck.  Overall, 7.5/10

content:
Posted: July 29, 2015
												Hello Hello! Welcome to Freddy F-bears pizza factory of hell! Just wait a moment as the Animatronics decide to feast on your very soul if you make the wrong move even once!I am of course refering to 20/20/20/20 mode!Hey guys, Shallow here with this great news update! We come to you live with living proof of my beating nights 1-6 in just one day!Yes, this is completely true! Whether or not you believe it, that doesn't matter! All that matters is that I know for a fact that I did!Five Nights at Freddy's really dives into the instant scary horror jumpscares. Even the first damn night you have the potential to die right as the night begins! (Which is around 1-2 AM if you were wondering!)This game offers a stressful environment In which even the first wrong move wiil lead to your downfall!Bonnie in the right door? Don't worry! With your trusty flashlight and door closing ability, you can keep the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ at bay as you comtemplate exactly why the hell you are playing the game in the first place! Oh, and don't even get me started on Chika!She'll pop in every now and then to give you a warm hug! Don't notice her by your right door? Well don't worry! Bonnie is on your side with his epic ability to SCREW YOU OVER! With his button disabling ability, you can no longer keep Chika and Bonnie at bay, with will lead to the death of yourself!On night three? Foxy to the rescue! With his shy nature and high speed, he will screw you up within the hour!Oh, did I mention he was camera shy? Keep the Camera's away from this beast, he might just kill you or take away some of your power!Oh, and don't even get me started on Golden Freddy! He just wants a hug as he sits next to your desk and DESTROY'S YOUR LIFE! Don't have a fast enough reaction speed? He'll just pop on in and KILL YOU WITHOUT MERCY!Well, you thought it was over didn't you? Night 3 is just the beginning. Come night four, you'll find yourself dying over and over again if you don't have the right strategy!Oh, did I mention that not only do you have to keep an eye on Foxy in case he'll bang on your door, that you ALSO have to keep an eye on Freddy on the show stage?That's right! Call now and we'll put 'Freddy's screwing machine' into play! All you have to do is not look at him the entire night and you'll find yourself dying faster than you can say; "OH SH*-But don't worry! As long as you check him constantly, he'll never move from the stage! That is to say that you're fast enough to check Foxy and Freddy within less than a damn second!Oh really?!?!? You beat night 5? Well guess the hell what!? YOU HAVE A SIXTH NIGHT!And you thought that night 5 was bad, this takes night 5 to the EXTREME! Constant dying over and over again if you mess up even once!Don't forget to check the door lights first before closing or opening the doors/camera. Bonnie and Chikc don't like waiting for you as you glance at your camera wondering to yourself: 'Where the hell did they go?'AND BOOM! YOU ARE DEAD JUST LIKE THAT!I'm sure after the 30th try that you'll finally beat it!HOLY DEAR LORD! YOU BEAT NIGHT 6?!?!?!? WELCOME TO THE CLUB!Now you've reached my level of play! I have no more advice to offer except that there is a 7th night! Good luck on your damn journey of DYING MORE THAN 100 FLIPPING TIMES!You beat 20/20/20/20?????!!!!! GOOD FUC*ING JOB! Now you have 3 stars, and a lot of wasted time!But, that's not all! THERE IS A SECOND GAME!Pros -Constant stress - Really brings out the jumpscares.Amazing AI attitude. - 4/20 is impossible without the right strat.Nice Jumpscares - No matter how many times I've seen them, I still jump when they show up!Cons -A bit...repeating. After night three, just do the same strategy from night 4 to night 6 and you can beat that part of the game easily.No extras menu - Not much of a con really. It'd just be nice to have that same option to see all the jumpscares among other things.Anyway, that's all! Shallow tuning out with a 9.7/10!

content:
Posted: September 17, 2014
												"Five Nights at Freddys" is a "Point-and-Click" Horror Game, The goal is to survive Five Nights at "Freddy fazbear's Pizzaria". THE STORY: your Mike Schmidt, You became the new nightwatch man at "Freddy Fazbear's Pizzaria" getting Paid four dollers a hour ( lower then the min wage in every state of the USA) for five days, each week you get paid one-hundered and twenty dollers. The Pizzaria's reputation is bad due to the murder of five childern and "The Bite Of '87" thus the Pizzaria is going bankrupt. Your job on the other hand is simple, work from 12AM to 6AM every night while avoid dying from the Animatronics (Endoskeletons) "Bonnie the Bunny", "Chica the Chicken", "Foxy the Pirate", and "Freddy Fazbear" Himself. [LET'S RECAP] Main Protagonist: Mike Schmidt. Main Antagonist: Freddy Fazbear. On your First Night, another watchman will call you to tell you about your job, the only thing you have to work with are, a Tablet, Metal Security Doors, and Door Lights. The Tablet shows your camera feed, the doors lock anything from coming in to your room, and the door lights light the area outside your door. Because of Buget cuts, your limited to a certen amout of power each night (starting with 99%) anything you do runs down the power so the player needs to limit on what he or she does with it. doing very little things will keep your power from running down fast, having too much stuff active will run the power down fast. There's more i can say but if you have no idea how the game works then ill let you figure that out (im pertty shure there's grammer issus with this review) -The Most Valuable Thing In The World: Infomation

content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												Five Nights at Freddy's is an indie psychological horror game. It is full of strategy, power management, and jumpscares. Lots of jumpscares... At first glance, Five Nights at Freddy's looks pretty silly and not frightening what so ever. I assure you, this isn't true. As I said, it is a psychological horror game. There is a lot of suspense, causing a lot of tension. You'll sit there for a few minutes without a single thing happening, then suddenly one of the animatronics are gone and you begin in panic as you look for it. You have to be very quick, as you don't have much time to react. And in some cases, if you make one mistake then its all over.The storyline for Five Nights at Freddy's is very intresting, as it isn't all given directly to you. You only get pieces of the storyline, and you have to make observations in the map to learn more. For example, you'll see newspapers and such hanging on the walls that go more in depth and show the story behind the place. The story is pretty dark, and is quite sad if you think about it.I would definitely reccomend Five nights at Freddy's to anyone who likes puzzle or strategy games while being able to enjoy a bit of jumpscares.Thanks for reading.

												Ah yes, Five Nights at Freddy's...The imagry in this game as well as the concept and idea's that truly are scary. though what makes this game truley great is the atmosphere. it's scary, freaky, unsettling and brings the nervousness into play.The game adapts to your playing style and will only kill you if you screw up by not noticing the tells of the animatronics, thus keeping you on your toes.My playing style was so erratic where the game was unable to properly mess with me like it did Markiplier and SomeOrdinaryGamers, so I had only gotten killed once in the game the entire time and that one time was due to how I forgot to check the doorlights which caused Chica to sneak into the security station and scream in my face.This game has some great atmosphere to it which actually made my skin crawl, I got very nervous on the first night due to Foxy surprisingly popping his head out at me with that contemplative look on his face on if he should charge me or not... that's when you KNOW some bad♥♥♥♥♥♥is about to go down when you see a animatronic pirate fox peeping out at you and thinking to himself, "Swiggity Swooty, Imma commin fer dat booty~"This game is a definite MUST HAVE for ANY horror enthusiast's collection!And now to wait patiently for a demo of Five Nights at Freddy's 2 or the full game to get even MORE terrified than I already am! :D10 killer animatronics out of 10!

content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												Five Nights at Freddy's is a first person, survival horror, point and click game. You work at Freddy Fazbears pizzeria, a place were the main attraction is Freddy Fazbear and his three friends. They are animatronic robots programmed to please the crowds, but have an unpredictable behavior at night. You are the night security guard, unfortunatly, and have to keep an eye on these animatronics while making sure that they don't get into your office and "forcefully stuff you into a Freddy Fazbear suit".The gameplay is simple, you are stuck in your office and have the ability to control the lights and doors to your office. You can also monitor the building through the cameras scattered around. To spice things up a bit, you have a limited amount of power that gets drained everytime you use the lights, doors and cameras, meaning that you have to leave yourself exposed in order to survive. The game also gets progressively more difficult after each night.This game has all the ingredients to make you extremly paranoid, due to the lighting, sound effects and creepy animatronics. The game awards you for remaining calm and using your recourses efficiently, and punishes you if you screw up and start to panic. It's also worth mentioning that the game will occasionally attempt to ruin your concentration by, among other things, flash detailed 3D images of perticular animatronics (notably terrifying).The story is very appealing. Scott Cawthon (the creator of FNAF) left us few clues, notes, messages and easter eggs for us to add up, only to find a creepy story that fits perfectly well into the game's setting.I really enjoyed playing this game at first during the first nights, it was a unique yet terrifying experience that few games has given me. But during the final nights the game was so difficult, it made me use a boring and repetetive strategy called "rinse and repeat" in order to complete the final night, which took away my freedom of choice to complete the game "my way". I didn't feel like playing the extra nights because it felt like a chore.This points out the biggest flaw and possibly the only flaw this game has, you need both skill and luck to complete the game. It could be a pro that adds to the experience or a con that ruins it.Anyway, this is a superb horror game that i would recommend to anyone who is interested in horror games. I can almost guarantee that you will scream like a little girl at least once while playing this game.10/10 would get stuffed into a Freddy Fazbear suit again.Are you ready for Freddy?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 12, 2014
												This is a game like no other. Its one of those rare games that will make you so paranoid, that you might just♥♥♥♥♥♥yourself. Or rather for me, smack your hands so hard against the table that you ache for hours. The atmosphere is so dark and dreary, the characters are well designed to terrorize you and the noises will haunt you even after you turn the game off. It’s a well-crafted playable nightmare. And you're going to get F!@#$% alot. So prepare to be scared. For the gameplay, its simple. You are an underpaid guard working at Freddys pizza joint & the animatronics for some reason think you need to be stuffed into a animatronic suit. Stripping off your skin and crushing your bones trying to get you inside one of those things. The game will start you off in a office room. There are two doors with buttons for closing & a security camera to check rooms with. You might be confused at first since you cannot move around, only look, click and check cameras but this is what makes the game so thrilling. There are so many unique mechanics in this and each character does something different and will appear at different doors. This is where strategy comes into play. You need to know what to do & how to prep yourself for each animatronic. This game will keep you engaged and with each night, pose a new threat and a greater challenge for you. And don't forget about all those lovely jumpscares! Even if you die a great # of times, you still get freaked out whenever Bonnie throws his face at you. So terrifying... For me, i honestly don't like getting scared & have never played too many horror games in my life. I tend to enjoy watching other play, but i couldn't stop loving this game, even if i tried. It was well made, i enjoy the characters even tho they want to stuff me into a suit & i want to know more about the background of how & why they are somehow alive! Overall i'd happily play this over & over again. (Tip: Don't try beating all 7 nights in one day, it will ruin your experience. Do this overtime!)10/10! - Must Play!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 26
												I am a huge fan of the series I have to say. Five Nights at Freddy's (FNAF for short) is a very popular indie horror game series. The game well know for youtubers (who I refuse to mention) overreacting to the game. The game is full of cheap jumpscares. These jumpscares may make you jump once or twice but not nearly as much as Youtubers made it out to be. It's overrated. The gameplay is simply. Check door lights , check a few rooms , and wait for the night to end. The game makes you a nervis reck though. When you have 6 percent power and an animatronic is wandering right outside your door ready to attack it really puts you on edge. The characters may sit outside your door for hours and it makes you crazy because you keep checking the light when they are not there. You never see the bots move ( except for one character) and are almost like sweeping angels because they only move when your not looking. There is so much that I wanted to say but I don't want to spoil. But you are most likely not going to figure out the story by just playing. But be observent because there are many easter eggs that will hint the story but you're most likely going to have to do some research to figure out the story. The jumpscares will probably were out by night 3. The fear of the unknow does too. And the game seems repetitive sometimes. But it still is a must check out game but it is still pretty overrated. Don't look up gameplay before playing and playthrough the whole game blind. Trust me. The game is different from a lot of horror games. But the game gets hard very fast and the fear goes away fast. Also listen to the phone. Sorry if my grammar is horrible. I struggle with that and I'm pretty lazy :/

content:
Posted: October 10, 2014
]What is "Freddy Fazbear's Pizzeria?"  A magical place for kids and grown-ups alike, where fantasy and fun come to life! Literally.  You are a security guard with a night shift at Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, a place similar to Chuck E. Cheese's. There's 4 animatronics, such as Bonnie Bunny, Chica Chick, Foxy, and of course, Freddy Fazbear. They're nice little friends for children to form their childhood with. Unfortunately, at night, things are a bit different.  These animatronics come alive. Yes, ALIVE. And they're out to... k-k-k-k-kill you! (Reference!)  Trying to conserver power, stay alive, and come out with enough time is not an easy task. Maybe it's not worth the minimum wage they're offering.

content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												This game is more of a novelty than a full-on survival game. It's something that you should definitely pick up as it's only 5$, and you'll get in a ton of good screams. It's more of a point-and-click type of game, as you won't need to use your keyboard at all to play this one. There's not really any skill involved either, it's more of just getting down the technique of the game and making choices that depend on the location of the wandering animatronic robots. It's almost a puzzle of sorts, but you'll need to make gambles as well. risking your precious power, which is always decreasing. It's definitely a fresh take on the whole horror genre, and will also make for a great Twitch/YouTube game to broadcast. There are definitely richer experiences on the Steam Store for the same modest price of 5$, but this is a game that is very unique and deserves your time.  I really do recommend you try to survive Five Nights at Freddy's, but I can't guarantee you'll make it past the first.Score: B+

content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
												Okay, so I've had the same review for Five Nights at Freddy's for a while now, and I wanted to change it as it was getting old in my mind, and it didn't really make sense to me after a while.First of all, let me get this out of the way...Five Nights at Freddy's is a singleplayer game. That means that the community has nothing to do with the content of the game itself. No matter how much you say the community is "Autistic", that's not going to alter the game in any way, as the last time I checked, the Fanbase did NOT alter or try to hack into the game to make it crappier.And no, I'm not a FNaF Fanboy. I prefer games like Portal, Garry's Mod and Terraria more. I just find it a bit annoying when people judge a game by its community. Especially when it's singleplayer.Anyways, onto the review. Story Five Nights at Freddy's is a short, fun, indie horror game made by Scott Cawthon that takes place in 'Freddy Fazbears Pizzaria'.  You're the security guard who pulled the short straw and works the nightshift, however. You must survive an entire week in the pizzaria, wiether you need the pay or you're forced to stay. Seems simple, right? Well, not exactly. There are 4 animatronics that are progreammed to entertain the children in the daytime. Well, what about the nightime? There are no children to entertain, so the workers set the animatronics to freeroam at night, so that their servos don't lock up and they won't be broken for the next day. Why the animatronics aren't always set to a freeroaming mode might seem obvious to you, but there's a bigger reason than just "They're killer robots. They come and try to kill me every single night." There was an incident placed in the year 1987, at a previous Freddy Fazbears Pizzaria resulting in someone's frontal lobe being bit off by an animatronic, although unknown to the player which one. This incident is simply known as "The Bite of '87". Gameplay With the first in the series, your goal is to survive until 6 AM, for a week. You are sitting in an office with entrances on both sides, both of which have a light button and a door button. Your goal is to survive until 6 AM, for a week. Both buttons on either side are toggleable, which is great, as when they're on, they drain your power supply, of which you have a limited amount of. When the power goes out, both the lights and doors deactivate, leaving the doors open and the lights off, which leaves you vulnerable to the several animatronics in the pizzaria, Freddy, Bonnie, Chica, and Foxy, designed after a bear, bunny, chicken and fox respectively. If you run out of power, as said before, your lights and doors won't work, and Freddy will appear in the left doorway playing a tune that sounds like it's being played out of a music box. Eventually, the tune will end, most likely being cut short, and the very dim light allowing you to still see your desk will darken, leaving you in a pitch-black office. After that, at a random time, Freddy will pop up and kill you, unless you're lucky enough for the time to roll over to 6:00 AM. While the power is still on, Bonnie, Chica and Foxy can attack, and Freddy can still move around and attack, although not in the way he does when the power's out. Bonnie and Chica just generically move around the facility, while Foxy can charge at your door when you either give him too much or too little attention, although that will only delay him. Foxy's charge is inevitable, and will almost always happen at least once on the later nights. Finishing Touches Five Nights at Freddy's is a neat, small game that can be played on most computers (MOST, not all) and can provide a couple hours of something to do. The animatronics aren't programmed in a way that you can just memorize which animatronic attacks when, which is something that can add some replayability, although not much. I will still support this game and reccomend it however.Thank you for taking time out of your day to read my review! I hope that you understand why I recommend it, and if you're one of those people who hate FNaF because of the community, maybe I changed your mind? Although unlikely, it could be possible. Have a good day!

content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												"Five Nights At Freddy's will put you in terror and have nightmares like never before. " 11/10 - IGNBut let's be serious here, FNAF is one of the most scariest games I have ever played. Oh and believe me when I say I played 100's EVEN 1000's of different horror games. This one really makes your heart race, palms sweat and just overall terrified. When I first saw this game, it didn't look scary to me at all. I thought "this looks boring....NEXT" but as I'm glad I contiuned to watch more I realize how truly scary it was. Oh god....when I played it for myself I had nightmares for 2 straight weeks. Now let's talk about the concept of this game. Well, it's unique and very simple. All you do is feel isolated in a room, check the cameras so often, use the lights and doors on either side. That's basically it. You may say "OH DATS SOUNDS SO BORING UGRH!" But as you see and hear these creepy animantronics getting closer to you. You have no choice but to wet your pants. But...since the concept is so good, devs are trying to steal Scott's idea. What amazes me is, just pictures put together with a very simple concept can make a game truly terrifiying. FNAF 2 has been greenlit. I'm indeed looking forward to the game. I love the new animantronics. I love the new room that you are now isolated in. I love the brand new mechanic, which is you can put a mask on to fool the old animantronics. But since the new animantronics have better technology, they can see you as a human unlike the old and slighty broken animantronics. But the thing that worries me the most is that FNAF 2 will get boring and won't be scary after about 1 hour like FNAF. I still find FNAF slighty scary but not as scary when I first played it. So if FNAF 2 manages to keep you on the edge of your sit at all times, then we will be wetting more pants.  But I am really looking forward to FNAF 2.  The time when I'm writing this, it's Halloween so HAPPY HALLOWEEN FNAF and all of you guys too. If you did actually read my review, thank you ^^ HAVE A GREAT NIGHT SLEEPING.

content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												This game is more of a novelty than a full-on survival game. It's something that you should definitely pick up as it's only 5$, and you'll get in a ton of good screams. It's more of a point-and-click type of game, as you won't need to use your keyboard at all to play this one. There's not really any skill involved either, it's more of just getting down the technique of the game and making choices that depend on the location of the wandering animatronic robots. It's almost a puzzle of sorts, but you'll need to make gambles as well. risking your precious power, which is always decreasing. It's definitely a fresh take on the whole horror genre, and will also make for a great Twitch/YouTube game to broadcast. There are definitely richer experiences on the Steam Store for the same modest price of 5$, but this is a game that is very unique and deserves your time.  I really do recommend you try to survive Five Nights at Freddy's, but I can't guarantee you'll make it past the first.Score: B+

This game is bad.So how about an Egg White Meringue Recipe?Separating Eggs:Cold eggs separate more easily than those at room temperature because the whites hold together better. separating egg yolk and egg whiteTo separate an egg: Crack the egg and hold the shell halves over a bowl. Transfer the yolk back and forth between the halves, letting the white drop into the bowl. Do not cut the yolk (whites containing any yolk will not beat properly). Transfer the yolk to another bowl.The tiniest bit of fat or egg yolk will wreck a meringue, as fat interferes with the formation of good foam. When separating eggs, if a speck of egg yolk falls into the egg whites, lift it out with an empty eggshell half. Do not try to fish it out with your fingers; the oil on your skin will prevent the egg whites from expanding.Avoid letting your fingers touch the areas that will come in contact with the egg whites. That way, you'll avoid leaving oils from your hands on the utensils you just washed.Room Temperature: After separating, bring egg whites to room temperature to ensure volume when beating (as warmer eggs whip faster than cold eggs). Egg whites right out of the refrigerator will not whip well. The ideal temperature to whip a common meringue is room temperature, about 70 degrees F. (21 degrees C.). Usually 30 minutes is adequate to obtain room temperature.A beaten egg white can foam to 6 to 8 times its original volume if the egg whites have been at room temperature for 30 minutes before beating.Bowls and Utensils:Copper, stainless-steel, or glass bowls work best for making meringues. Avoid using plastic bowls for whipping egg whites as they can often harbor traces of grease or fat, which prevents the whites from getting stiff. Whichever type of bowl you use, be sure it is spotlessly clean. Make sure that all your utensils are immaculately clean, completely grease-free, and completely dry. Meringues are very sensitive and they don't like any moisture.Place the egg whites into a large, tall bowl and set your mixer to medium-high speed. NOTE: I would not hand beat a meringues (too much work). Beating or whisking causes the protein in the egg whites to unfold, forming films that trap the air bubbles, and the sugar stiffens the foam. As the mixing time increases, the bubbles become smaller and more numerous; this increases the volume and makes a more-stable structure.Adding Sugar:Do not add sugar before whipping the egg whites. Adding sugar at the beginning can double the time you have to whip the egg whites to get a foam. Add the sugar at the very end when the whites have formed soft peaks.I like to use superfine sugar when making meringue because it dissolves faster than table sugar. When beating egg whites and the recipe calls for sugar, Gradually add the sugar, a few spoonfuls at a time and beating the whole time.As a general rule, add a total of 1/4 cup of granulated or superfine sugar for each egg white. Do not make meringues that have less than 2 tablespoons of sugar per egg white. If you use any less, the foam will not set and the meringue will shrink. To tell if the sugar is dissolved when you are beating egg whites for meringues, rub a bit of the foam between your fingers. If it feels gritty, the sugar is not dissolved, so keep beating for a few minutes. It should feel completely smooth when the sugar is dissolved.By varying the amount of sugar in the final mix, you control how hard or soft the final meringue will be:For soft peaks - Place egg whites in a clean glass or metal bowl (not plastic), and beat with an electric mixer on medium speed or with a rotary beater until egg whites form peaks with tips that curl over when the beaters are lifted. For stiff peaks, continue beating egg whites on high speed until they form peaks with tips that stand straight when the beaters are lifted.For stiff peaks - Continue beating egg whites on high speed until they form peaks with tips that stand straight when the beaters are lifted. Once you start a making whipped egg whites, continue it straight through and finish it off. Do not stop halfway to take a break. The meringue is done when it is not runny and when you can hold a spoonful of it upside down and none of it drops off. Also when you swirl a spoon through it and the swirls hold their shape indefinitely. Using Meringue:Make the meringue first - then prepare the filling (such as pie filling).Place meringue on the piping-hot filling to begin cooking the bottom of the meringue. The residual heat carried by the filling cooks the base of the meringue ever so slightly, making it less prone to leaking or shrinking. Make sure the meringue completely covers the hot filling right up to the edge of the crust. This helps the bottom of the meringue cook and stick to the filling so it will not slide off the when it is cut. Use a small spoon or spatula to make high peaks and decorative swirls in the meringue before baking.Baking Meringue:Meringues will become more done if you bake them at a lower temperature for a longer time. Bake the meringue at 325 degrees F. for 20 to 30 minutes or until a cooking thermometer registers 160 degrees F. Remember a hot filling is importantCutting Meringue:To cut baked meringue into serving pieces, use a knife dipped in cold water.Enjoy your delicious Meringue :)

content:
Posted: September 5, 2014
												This game became wildly popular recently, and I liked the visuals of it, so I got into it pretty fast - and I watched a LOT of videos of people playing it. The gameplay is pretty simple, but deceivingly so - I had to have watched at least ten different playthroughs of this game, and I thought I would be completely unphased once I started playing.This is not the case, however. This game is about managing resources, surveying your surroundings while trying to defend yourself, constantly being on the defensive, all while the forces of RNG, programmed AI, and straight up paranoia cause this to be a much more daunting task than one would expect.This game contains jumpscares, but honestly those aren't the scary part (and for those who have seen videos of this game, for some reason people turn the sound up to ridiculous levels... you can turn it to a reasonable level and the jumpscares aren't so dang loud.) I like them when they happen, because they're pretty well done and only occur when you've failed, but the really scary thing about this game is sitting, waiting, panicking while trying not to run out of electricity, and hearing something moving around, which could be any number of things, all of which might be close enough to kill you within seconds.I like being terrified by horror games, and this one definitely gets to me, and I love it. I think playing this game is legitimately the first time I've ever been happy to be nauseous from how panicked I got.(I also love the designs of the animatronics, they're fun to draw, but that's not exactly relevant to a video game review.)

content:
Posted: October 15, 2014
												This game is really good because i like how its different from all the other horror games, In all the horror games they make you scared because they make your do stuff you dont want to do but in this game you let the monsters get to you nad the high pitch sound is really surprising. But 1 thing, if you play this game for long you kinda know when they are in your office ready for the jumpscare. The hidden lore if really cool aswell like the bite of 87 or the 5 missing children and the changing posters. I recommend this game for someone who wants something different in horror games and likes hidden lore that YOU have to find out

content:
Posted: October 10, 2014
]What is "Freddy Fazbear's Pizzeria?"  A magical place for kids and grown-ups alike, where fantasy and fun come to life! Literally.  You are a security guard with a night shift at Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, a place similar to Chuck E. Cheese's. There's 4 animatronics, such as Bonnie Bunny, Chica Chick, Foxy, and of course, Freddy Fazbear. They're nice little friends for children to form their childhood with. Unfortunately, at night, things are a bit different.  These animatronics come alive. Yes, ALIVE. And they're out to... k-k-k-k-kill you! (Reference!)  Trying to conserver power, stay alive, and come out with enough time is not an easy task. Maybe it's not worth the minimum wage they're offering.

content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
												This game is by far the most scariest game I have ever played. I tell other people to play the game because I get a laugh out of how scared they get. I let my best friend play the game who loves scary games. He kept hitting the escape button because he was getting so scared and jumpy. Hitting the escape button closes the game and I wish I could unbind it but besides that a great game.
